isis.stitle: New Vehicle Loss and Damage Procedures Manual - Deliveries to Body Companies

svcproc.title: Deliveries to Body Companies
svcproc.para: Each chassis delivered to a body company must receive a careful inspection and the carrier's freight bill must be annotated to show a description of the damage or the shortage, whichever is applicable. This notation must be signed by the individual receiving the vehicle(s) and co-signed by the carrier representative at the time of delivery. If concealed damage is found, the same rule applies as if received at a dealership.
A vehicle belonging to a dealer but delivered and consigned to a body company or fleet location has been delivered to the dealer's agent.

step1.para: It is the dealer's responsibility to instruct the body company on proper receiving/inspection procedures, and to file the DDEW Warranty Claim for exceptions and other losses on the vehicle via International.

It is the responsibility of the body company to have an employee to receive and carefully inspect each vehicle or chassis delivered there. This person should also record damages and shortages on the carrier's delivery receipt, co-sign the delivery receipt, and get the carrier's (driver's) signature. Please refer to the New Vehicle Processing Manual, CTS-1029 and the Warranty Procedures and Administrative Policies Manual, CTS-1100.
Torque all axle shaft nuts and or u-joints to specification per Preparation and Delivery (P&D) guidelines before moving the vehicle.
If concealed damage is found, follow the instructions under "CONCEALED DAMAGE" above for the proper handling for notification of concealed damage.
